critical_workflows: Accessing the Cleveland Clinic Website and Navigating to a Specific Department
Finding a Doctor and Viewing Their Profile
Scheduling an Appointment (as a Returning Patient)

test_scenarios.name: Verify Website Availability and Navigation to Cardiology Department
steps: Open a web browser and navigate to https://my.clevelandclinic.org
Use the website's navigation (e.g., main menu or search bar) to find the 'Cardiology' department
Navigate to the Cardiology department page
test_scenarios.expected_result: The Cleveland Clinic homepage loads without errors. The Cardiology department page loads successfully.

test_scenarios.name: Find a Doctor and View Their Profile (Dr. Example Cardiology)
steps: From the Cleveland Clinic website (https://my.clevelandclinic.org), use the 'Find a Doctor' search functionality.
Search for a doctor by name (e.g., a generic 'Dr. Example' in Cardiology) or specialty ('Cardiologist').
Select a doctor from the search results.
test_scenarios.expected_result: A list of doctors matching the search criteria is displayed. Selecting a doctor navigates to their profile page.

test_scenarios.name: Schedule an Appointment (Returning Patient - Quick Scheduling)
steps: From the Cleveland Clinic website (https://my.clevelandclinic.org), locate and click on the 'Schedule an Appointment' or 'MyChart' login button.
Log in using valid returning patient credentials (username/password).
Navigate to the scheduling section within MyChart or the scheduling tool.
Attempt to schedule an appointment using a 'quick schedule' option or similar streamlined flow with a known provider.
test_scenarios.expected_result: The patient successfully logs in to MyChart. The scheduling interface loads. The appointment can be scheduled, and a confirmation page is displayed.
